entry.title: Optimizing Asset Maintenance Process In SAP S4HANA With Resource Scheduling
entry.content:
In this blog, I will be walking through how we can handle the resource scheduling for maintenance orders that are part of Phase Based Maintenance framework.

My Business Use Case:

My organization is a Calcined Process Industry and follows phase-based maintenance framework for Reactive and Proactive Maintenance activities. Lately, production team reported that the belt conveyor BC01 belt has torn and ripped in raw material handling area, i.e., Coke Pad. So I have created a Reactive Maintenance order for Belt Conveyor(BC01). Also, I do have scheduled Preventive Maintenance orders for Kiln-01, Belt Conveyor(BC02), and Belt Conveyor(BC03).

If you want to gain a deep understanding of Phase-Based maintenance framework, please find the blog links below.

  • Phase-Based Maintenance Process With Lean Services in SAP S4 HANA Asset Management. 

 

  • Let`s get down to nitty-gritty of "Manage Workflows for Maintenance Orders"-S4 HANA Asset Management 

 

  • Planning, Adding & Approving Lean Services Using Flexible Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. 

The crux of the SAP S4HANA Asset Management "Resource Scheduling" :

Resource scheduling in SAP S4HANA enables efficient planning of maintenance tasks by providing visibility into workload, capacities, and work center utilization aspects. We can use the apps for resource scheduling to check current and forecasted work center utilization, build schedules, and determine required capacities before dispatching the scheduled work.

Key Benefits Include, but are not limited to:

  • Build an optimal schedule through simulation analysis for open maintenance orders before releasing for execution.
  • Group and Schedule maintenance orders by assets.
  • Control Maintenance Workloads by adjusting activities in the schedule.
  • Distribute Work evenly across capacities and collaborating across other schedulers.

I will be using FIORI Apps listed below for this walk through.

Mini Note: With an additional license, we can use "Resource Scheduling" for maintenance work centers and assign maintenance crew to these work centers. We can dispatch individual order operations and pass the maintenance orders to the "Execution Phase".

First things first...let us "Make Basic Settings for Resource Scheduling" and create a Work Center Team.

Creating work centers team can make planner or supervisor`s job easier, because they can choose suitable team members when they plan maintenance work. A work center can be linked to exactly one team, and a team can be linked to exactly one work center. In addition, a person can only be assigned to one work center team at a time.

For Instance, I have created four teams to represent the Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation, and Safety departments.

Mechanical Team:

Electrical Team:

Instrumentation Team:

Safety Team:

 

The overall teams for Calcination Maintenance are as follows:

 

Now let us get into our Scheduling process. to do so, let us first submit the maintenance orders for scheduling in the "Manage Maintenance Backlog" app. With this action we pass the maintenance orders on to the "Scheduling" phase.

I have created a maintenance planning bucket for Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation, and Safety work centers.

Now let us look at the backlog overview.

 

 

Once we are confident that all the required resources will be available on the required dates, we can select individual orders in the "Manage Maintenance Backlog" app and choose submit for scheduling.

Following the successful submission, the system updates the phase status.

 

Now let us view the dashboard using "Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planners".

 

Now let us assign the person responsible for the maintenance order operations by using the card "Unassigned Work".

Now let us assign the team members to perform the job. Based on the assignment made in the "Manage Teams for Work Center" for the performing work center, the system displays the team members for each performing work center.

For Mechanical Works:

For Electrical Works:

For Instrumentation Works:

For Safety Works:

Once we assign the maintenance team members to the operations, the assignment status changes to "Assigned".

Now let us check the due maintenance order operations by priority.

Now let us add three maintenance orders to the schedule.

We can add the  due maintenance orders to the existing schedule if any, or we can create a new schedule. For Instance let us create a new schedule for the "WEEK 33".

Now the schedule status has changed to "Scoping".

Once all the work orders are assigned to the schedule "2025_CAL_MAINT_WEEK_33",  we can  use "Manage Schedule" to monitor the utilization aspects.

We can visualize the work center utilization by many attributes. For instance, let us consider processing status attribute.

Manage Schedule - List View:

Manage Schedule - Graphical View:

We have a lot many options to visualize the data.

We can change the performing work center.

 

Now let us look at the elephant in the room, i.e., "Maintenance Scheduling Board".

For Instance, let us consider the date range, work centers, and priority as per our maintenance orders.

 

and also let us select the maintenance order operations having status "DUE".

To view the work centers, we can use the option "My Work Centers".

Now let us visualize the data using the option "Orders and Resources".

we can update the constraints( Must Start Date &Time), Change Performing Work Center, Dispatch or Assign/Unassign people for the Maintenance Order Operations.

For Instance, let us update the constraint for one of the operations.

We can assign and unassign the people.

We can move the operations to next week by dragging and dropping to ensure the utilization is not more than 100%.

Now let us maintain the relationships and dispatch the operations.

We can maintain Offset/Edit Offset/Delete Offset, and create "Relationships" between operations. For Instance, let us add "2 HRs" offset to one of the operations.

We can Edit or Delete Offset or Relationship.

Once we dispatch the operations, the maintenance order phase moves to the "Execution Phase" and sub-phase moves to "Ready For Execution (Order)".

Now let us visualize the "Scheduling Overview by Asset Wise". For Instance, let us select "Belt Conveyor-01".

We can visualize an asset in its hierarchical structure. Also, we can graphically view the maintenance work planned for the asset and all its sub-assets.

 

Collaborating on a Schedule: We can share a schedule that we created or review a schedule that someone shared with us. The activity log helps us track the changes made by co-planners and reviewers of our schedule. We can also post and reply to the comments in the log.

As the maintenance orders and operations have been dispatched, let us use app. "Manage Schedule" to visualize the work center utilization and share the schedule.

First visualize the work center utilization by "Processing Status".

Now let us share with one of our peers.

 

Now, "Chandana Chelikam" reviews our schedule and provides her feedback on the schedule completeness by accessing the "Manage Schedules -For Review" app.

 

Now, let us view her feedback (activity log) and reply to her using  "Manage Schedules -For Review" app.

 

Now let us "Freeze" the schedule by choosing "Freeze Schedule" option.

Now the schedule "2025_CAL_MAINT_WEEK_33"  status becomes " FROZEN".

 

Once the schedule is "Frozen", we can no longer change the schedule. If any new operations are added and dispatched to be completed within the schedule after the schedule was frozen, then the status of those operations under "Completion In Schedule" will shown as "Dispatched In Addition".

 

Now let us track the "Execution Of a Schedule".

Once the schedule period starts, the schedule status changes to "Execution". We can start tracking schedule attainment and the completion of the order operations in our schedule. The prerequisite is that the schedule must be "Frozen" before the schedule period starts.

We can track it either using "Manage Schedule app." or "My Schedules" card in the "Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planners app".

Once we complete the maintenance operations at shop floor, let us confirm the operations using "Perform Maintenance Jobs" app.

For Instance, let us use the option "Quick Confirm".

 

Schedule Attainment: Let us use the "Manage Schedule" app. to view the schedule attainment ratio.

Post maintenance order operations confirmations, The micro chart for the  "Attainment" shows the ratio of the work that was planned for the schedule period  and the work that was completed as planned in the schedule period.

let us visualize the operations completed in schedule between 18.08.2025 to 24.08.2025.

Mini Note: When the operations are not in the schedule at the time of the schedule freeze, and those are dispatched for and completed in the schedule period after the schedule is frozen, the status for those operations is shown as "Completed in Addition".

 

This brings me to the end of my process walk through. 😊 I hope my blog proves useful to the Maintenance Team. I look forward to seeing Maintenance Team using "Resource Scheduling"  functionality to optimize maintenance operations and enhance asset reliability.

 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C

entry.title: Filter and sort for custom field in Transportation Cockpit don't work.
entry.content:
Hi, 

In Transportation Cockpit FU Stages hierarchy, there is a new custom field. 
But filtering and sorting with this new custom field don't work.
Nothing happens when i click on the header of this new custom field.

What can be the solution?

Best Regards

entry.title: फोनपे में गलत ट्रांजेक्शन से पैसे कैसे वापस पाएं?
entry.content: Phone Pe में गलती से किसी गलत खाते में पैसे ट्रांसफर हो जाने पर, तुरंत Phone Pe ग्राहक सहायता 👉08084°541÷543 से संपर्क करें और अपने बैंक को भी सूचित करें. इसके अलावा, यदि 8084×541~543 संभव हो तो, उस व्यक्ति से संपर्क करें जिसे आपने गलती से पैसे भेजे हैं और उनसे पैसे वापस करने का अनुरोध करें

Am i missing any config ?

entry.title: Unable to login during connecting ABAP service instance to Cloud environment
entry.content:
Hi,
I have an ABAP cloud instance in my BTP trial account.
From Eclipse editor, when i am trying to connect the ABAP service instance for connecting to the cloud environment, I am able to specify the ABAP service instance URL, but in the next step, when i am trying to login via 'Open Logon Page in Browser' i am NOT ABLE to login even after giving the correct credentials. I am using same user (P user) for BTP trail account. Its throwing me invalid credential errors. Can anyone tell me what's going wrong ?

entry.title: Re: Triggering Process in Shared Environments from SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
1) I need more information here: Which project does this appear? Screenshot? What are you executing at that moment? How are you displaying/seeing the message -- Alert box, developer tools, SAP Build Monitoring?

2) That's a real technical message I've never seen before.

I just wrote on LinkedIn how great the community is, and it is. But it also can be infuriating -- me and everyone here (almost) has jobs, families, hobbies -- we want to help but to make a context switch and then to understand where you are in your debugging is nearly impossible, and given that you are on your own network, perhaps controlled by your company's IT, going through how many routers and firewalls, with a SAP BTP commercial model of who knows what, using who knows what service plan, with instances and destinations set up in myriad possible ways, and with no access to see them, and with no debugging information to understand where is the problem (SAP Build Apps, SAP Build Process Automation, destination configuration, integration configuration, browser, network, Build Apps user interface) and not knowing where these messages appear (SAP Build Monitoring tab for an instance, popup in Build Apps, in Developer Tools during API call, perhaps when testing a destination in the SAP BTP cockpit) -- it's all very difficult, and we and the rest of the community are not support but people who curious and very much want to help people.

I don't mean to rant on you -- this is something I've been thinking about a long time and has been frustrating me for a long time, perhaps since 2004 and the days of SDN (at the risk of aging me) 😸

entry.title: Re: Data transfer from multiple models to one common mode...
entry.content:
@Sowmiya_Chinnappan 

I am not sure if you want to create a totally new model for this consolidation or use one of the existing model. Choose the largest model in terms of dimension as your consolidation model ( if existing model is being chosen). If a new model is created, align it to be in line with largest dimension model. If possible use the same dimensions (public dimension) to create the consolidation model . 

While copying data from models with lesser dimension you can keep assigning #. May be keep an audit dimension to track the model source.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Cost Center Splitting Weights Integrated Financial Pl...
entry.content: @Chris1973Thank you for your prompt response. I have already implemented step 1, but in this case, it doesn’t work with the Splitting Weight measure since it is model-based. If I create a restricted measure as a story-based measure, I cannot reuse it in the other two story measures — Subtotal Driver 2 and % Splitting Weight. I have already locked the version separately by applying a filter on the Plan Version in the editor’s filter section. The remaining two cannot be applied, as the only model-based measure in the standard content is Splitting Weight Driver 2. I’m not sure how to proceed with this or what mistake I might be making.

entry.title: QM- MIC - Classed Recording
entry.content:
Classed Recording is

  • Used for quantitative characteristics.
  • Instead of recording each individual measurement, record how many samples fall into defined class ranges.

Master Data Setup

Step 1: Activate Classed Recording Indicator in MIC

 

Step 2: Maintain Quantitative Data for MIC

  • Tolerance- Upper, Lower, Target
  • No of Classes with * in Class width & Class mid-point (It will Auto calculate)
 

Result Recording

In RR Screen,

  • As Maintained, No of Classes as 5. It reflected with Class Width of 4 {90-94,94-98…=5}
  • Also, an extra Class is to warn user that it's out of Specification or Tolerance.
 

After Result Recording, It show average (96.) as below

  • Avg of First Class that recorded = (90+94)/2 =92
  • Avg of Third Class that recorded = (98+102)/2 =100
  • Avg of all Class that recorded = (92+100)/2=96
 

#SAPQM

entry.title: Measures or account dimension in term of performance - SAC for planning
entry.content:
I have the following dilemma.
I have a new model and I don't need both account and measures. therefore, the first option is to create an account dimension and one "value" measure. Or a list of ~50 measures and no-account dimension.

I have few design reasons to prefer one of the options,

however my question is which option will provide a better performance?

 

thank you

entry.title: Re: एचडीएफसी से पैसे कट गए तो क्या करें?-हेल्पलाइन नंबर
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: What is the best course of action for customers on IM and those in WM?
entry.content:
Hi Alan,

I have a question regarding the information you shared in the IM level, specifically where you mentioned: "If your warehouse processes are basic and manual, complement IM with Stock Room Management in S/4HANA, which provides basic bin-level inventory without advanced warehouse features."

As far as I understand, the Stock Room Management option is only available to existing WM (LE-WM) users on ECC and cannot be used as a separate solution in S/4HANA. According to your statement, it seems that a simple warehouse can be configured in S/4HANA as Stock Room Management instead of EWM. Could you please clarify this point?

entry.title: Re: Bank Guarantee as noted item in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @charlene2 

The traditional Special G/L indicators for bank guarantees (E/I) are not available in S4HANA Public Cloud. Only A (customer down payment) and K (vendor down payment) are supported.

  • Simple tracking → Post a down payment (A/K) and use it as a proxy for the guarantee.
  • Full lifecycle → Use Treasury & Risk Management (FIN-TRM) with the Manage Bank Guarantees app.
  • If TRM is not in scope → Build a Custom Business Object (CBO) to capture and report guarantee details.

Bank guarantees cannot be listed as noted items in Public Cloud. Use down-payments as a proxy or TRM to represent appropriate guarantees management.

SAP Help TRM - Bank guarantee

SAP Help Bank Guarantees

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Issue with Override of Complete Delivery Flag in Sales Order Simulation API
entry.content:
Issue Summary

When using the Sales Order Simulation API (API_SALES_ORDER_SIMULATION_SRV) the parameter `CompleteDeliveryIsDefined = false` does not override the customer master setting for Complete Delivery. The system continues to enforce the Complete Delivery flag from master data, preventing partial confirmations, unlike the behavior in VA01.

Business Impact

The Commerce Cloud integration relies on the Sales Order Simulation API to provide accurate ATP results. Due to this issue, customers flagged for “Complete Delivery” in master data cannot receive partial confirmation results through API simulation, even though the payload contains  the needed ‘false’ flag. This results in inconsistent behavior between API-based processing and direct SAP GUI order creation, impacting order confirmation accuracy and eCommerce customer experience.

Question:
In VA01, when creating a Sales Order manually and removing the Complete Delivery flag, ATP check works correctly and allows partial confirmations. When Commerce Cloud sends payload to S/4 with "CompleteDeliveryIsDefined: false’ aiming to remove the complete delivery flag (like VA01), S/4 is not respecting this override and not allowing ATP to return partial confirmations.

  1. Why is this behavior different between direct GUI order creation and API-based order simulation, even when both aim to turn off the complete delivery requirement?
    2. Is there any SAP Note, configuration setting, development options, or workaround available to enable the simulation logic in S/4 to respect this flag ("CompleteDeliveryIsDefined: false’ ) and override the master data during order simulation via API?

entry.title: Re: SAP Window always appearing in Eclipse
entry.content:
I don't know what you mean saying "eclipse with Java script".

What I know is Eclipse but it's unrelated to "Java script" (!?).

SE11 or Eclipse depends on the versions of both Eclipse ADT and the ABAP backend. In the latest versions, it will show the table as Dictionary DDL. In older versions, it will show the table via SE11 e.g. with backend ABAP 7.52 SP 4, it will show the table only via SE11, with back ABAP 7.58 it will show by default as Dictionary DDL.

Examples for the table T000:

  • Dictionary DDL:

  • SE11

For information, you may switch from Dictionary DDL to SE11 via Open With > SAP GUI (right click on the table). 

NB: you have tagged incorrectly with "SAP BTP ABAP environment" and "SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment", in S/4HANA Cloud (i.e. Public), SAP GUI is not available. The correct tag is simply "ABAP Development" and you may add any other user tag you want.

entry.title: Re: Measures or account dimension in term of performance...
entry.content:
@Deb_D 

There is no thumb rule here but a hybrid approach is more optimized. A lot will depend on what kind of data or planning is being implemented. For a Financial Reporting /Planning, its always better to use Accounts along with measures. One thing to note is account based modelling creates more rows of data records in model. Measure based modelling creates more columns. Any keyfigure which is applicable to all rows should be pushed in measures. For e.g. Quantity/HC etc. If you need a structure in your keyfigures ( parent child ), you need to model them in accounts and Measures do not support hierarchy in itself. If you need Account Type treatment ( financial reporting case), you need to have accounts. So study all your data types that will reside in your model and then take a call where to put the metrics modelling to Accounts/Measures. In my view a hybrid approach with both seems reasonable.

Also refer to the section below for some guidance

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/22af95d0151c4946b132d4e904b1e32a.html#choosing-a-model-configuration

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: PR quantity in PO
entry.content: How to block the PR line in PR, my requirement is that i don't need the PR open quantity in PO without changing the Quantity in PR. If there are any other options which is Manual process is also ok.

entry.title: Re: What is the best course of action for customers on IM and those in WM?
entry.content: While Stock Room Management (SRM) in S/4HANA is indeed designed primarily for installed base customers currently using WM (LE‑WM) in ECC, it is also technically available to new or greenfield customers, as long as they have the SAP S/4HANA Enterprise Management license. There’s no licensing prohibition preventing new customers from implementing SRM.

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere: Versions Not Visible in SAP Dataspher...
entry.content:
Hi, you need authorizations on TST and PRD. On DEV you have the Modeler role, on TST and PRD not. Just try to add the Space Admin f.e. 

You did not write if basis sees the version, or not. I assume yes and the helplessness is caused by some other factor 🙂

entry.title: Additional Charges in Sales Invoice
entry.content:
Hello experts,

My client needs to record a delivery charges in Sales invoice without hitting the Revenue G/L account. Their scenario is that they collect Delivery charges from the Customer and deliver the Goods by themself and record that charges in the Sales invoice additionally. How can  we do this ?
